column4: to restart X you can do Control + alt + backspace or /etc/init.d/gdm or kdm or xdm restart

Hello. I got two different X window using nvidia on two different monitors with different resolutions. Opening a window from one monitor opens it in the current monitor, but dialogs and for instance the gsudo dialog go always to the first monitor. How can this behaviour be changed? Thanks
the DISPLAY variable should influence where an app starts, but what do you want the behavior to change to?

the thing is dialogs created from applications as when you try to get superuser permisions get always to the first screen. I would like all the sons of applications to be created in the same screen as the father
how does it behave if you set DISPLAY?  Like:  DISPLAY=:0.0 gedit
correctly, it creates the application in the first monitor, I can change display to create it on the second monitor. That's not the problem
so it's NOT specific to administration applications?
now that you say it... It may be... I just realised the problem with the input password application. I think you are right with that guess
because I'm pretty sure that by default, a command you run through sudo will not inherit DISPLAY
how can I change this behaviour? I don't know very well the details of getting superuser powers
I just tested, seems sudo preserves DISPLAY actually
ok well, let's try a different approach.  Do you know why the administration apps open up on the other monitor?
mmm... I don't know why. Because it's the primary monitor I guess, but I don't wanna be changing which monitor is the primary as that involves changing xorg.conf every time
ok, so why do the regular apps not start there?
it's another Xserver if I understood correctly the concept of "different X screens", so this means that they inherit a different DISPLAY value when created
so they start there because you start them from the menu there?
yes, or from a console form here, or so on
I see now, though I'm not sure why dialogs would ignore DISPLAY
do you think that gdevilspie can help here?
I didn't know devilspie could send things to other X servers, but even if it can, it would be hard to write a rule that says: open dialogs where the parent window is
yes, It cannot send things to other Xservers, checked :(
any idea about where to ask, what can make the problem or even how to make a google search, because I've not been able to find anything interesting
your best bet is to find someone that also has your setup :P  I would try here later, some other linux channels (##linux maybe), forums too.  My google searches have also been less than fruitful
well gl, I'm off for a bit
